LIVE: Watch the ribbon-cutting for our new Earth Information Center at NASA Headquarters in Washington. The new tool will provide data to the public and decision makers to help adapt and respond to our changing planet: https://go.nasa.gov/eic

Astronauts-eye view 

Take a look through the helmet cams of 
@Astro_Woody
 and Steve Bowen as they prepare to install a roll-out solar array during today's spacewalk.

Suits are set to battery power and today's spacewalk is underway!

This is Hoburg's second spacewalk and Bowen's 10th—tying a record for most spacewalks made by a U.S. astronaut.

Welcome to the team!

In the early universe, the gas between stars and galaxies was opaque – energetic starlight could not penetrate it. But 1 billion years after the big bang, the gas had become completely transparent. Why? New data from @NASAWebb has pinpointed the reason: https://go.nasa.gov/3qCcOmn

Scientists detected a gamma-ray burst on Oct. 9, 2022, that they called the BOAT: Brightest Of All Time. Data from our @NASAUniverse NuSTAR telescope provided clues about the collapsing star that triggered this record-breaking event. https://go.nasa.gov/3qvQt9L

Love space but nervous to travel 1.8 billion miles? That’s okay!

Another exciting week at NASA in the books!

The #CRS28 mission delivered cargo to the @Space_Station and @NASA_Astronauts Steve Bowen and @Astro_Woody performed a spacewalk to upgrade the space station’s power supply.

Get all the details: http://nasa.gov/subscribe

Smoke from wildfires in Quebec moved across eastern portions of Canada and the U.S. this week. This @NASAEarth computer model used satellite, aircraft, and ground-based data to track the black carbon particles (soot) and hazardous air. https://go.nasa.gov/3J4yaiu

Today our #NASAInterns completed their first week at @NASA. Already these #ArtemisGeneration interns are putting their talent and creativity to work for the betterment of all. 

Welcome to the team!
.@NASA_Astronauts Stephen Bowen and @Astro_Woody successfully installed and deployed the space station's fifth roll-out solar array during a six-hour and three-minute spacewalk today.
Upgrade in progress: a new solar array unrolls on the @Space_Station. It will produce more than 20 kilowatts of electricity to augment the station's power supply and support more @ISS_Research.

Hurricane season in the Atlantic begins today. Our unique perspective from space allows us to study storms and their evolution, providing data to support forecasting and disaster responses: https://go.nasa.gov/3fYNZYE

I just reached a milestone only surpassed by Opportunity: 30 km on Mars   

I've explored so much in my 10-plus-year trek through Gale Crater, but there are many more rocks to sample and analyze! Retrace my tracks with this interactive map: http://go.nasa.gov/3EtmSCi

The diversity of our NASA team is what brings different perspectives to our missions, and we celebrate and share their stories. To protect our people from personal attacks, we have decided to limit comments on this post.

This month and every month, we recognize the achievements and contributions of our Asian American, Native Hawaiian, and Pacific Islander workforce.
